page.title: 15WHERE WE LIVE 3
page.content: Beside the betting shop there is a mini-cab hire firm. Then you see a Baptist Church Hall, a public library and finally Beckton Park which has a lido. You have now arrived at the Newham Way which is the principal road for commuters from S.E. Essex into the heart of London. If you turn around and walk south along Prince Regent's Lane on the east side you find mostly houses. Half way down you find eight shops and the Nottingham Public House. Further south you find a grocer's and a butcher's shop. You then arrive back to where we started, Alnwick Road and the Galleon Club.
